name: Bent's Old Fort National Historic Site
description: In the 1840s the Arkansas River was the border between territory claimed by the United States and Mexico. Located along the river, Bent's Fort was an adobe trading post on the Santa Fe Trail, where traders, trappers, travelers, and the Cheyenne and Arapaho tribes came together in peaceful terms for trade. Today, a reconstructed fort allows visitors to explore the front line of Westward Expansion.
shortDescription: In the 1840s the Arkansas River was the border between territory claimed by the United States and Mexico. Located along the river, Bent's Fort was an adobe trading post on the Santa Fe Trail, where tr...

operatingHours.description:
The park grounds are open from 9:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m., except on New Year's Day, the Birthday of Martin Luther King, Jr, Washington's Birthday, Thanksgiving Day, and Christmas Day. During the off-season [October-March annually], the grounds are open daily from 9:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m., except for the holidays listed above.

Access into the reconstructed fort on a separate scheduleâ€”see the event calendar for hours of operation on scheduled plaza access days.

climate.weatherDescription: Summer temperatures are often in the high 90s and low 100s. Weather is generally fair in the fall and spring. Winter temperatures can be below freezing. Most of the fort is unheated and does not have modern cooling systems, so dress accordingly.

images.title: Horse and Mule in the Plaza
images.altText: Two animals are tied to a wooden frame in the interior of a large adobe structure.
images.caption: Horse and Mule in the Plaza

images.title: Bent's Old Fort
images.altText: Bent's Old Fort with shortgrass prairie in foreground and blue sky and clouds above
images.caption: For much of its 16-year history, the fort was the only major permanent white settlement on the Santa Fe Trail between Missouri and the Mexican settlements.

images.title: Boxes and Furs
images.altText: Wooden boxes and buffalo furs are scattered around a plaza inside an adobe fortification.
images.caption: Boxes and Furs in the Plaza.

images.title: Bent's Old Fort
images.altText: Bent's Old Fort with shortgrass prairie, tepee and wagon in foreground and blue sky & clouds above
images.caption: For much of its 16-year history, the fort was the only major permanent white settlement on the Santa Fe Trail between Missouri and the Mexican settlements.

images.title: Beads in the Trade room
images.altText: bundles of glass trade beads tied together hang from a wooden rafter
images.caption: Trade Room beads

images.title: Bent's Old Fort at night
images.altText: An adobe fort with lights under a starry sky
images.caption: Bent's Old Fort at night

images.title: Bent's Old Fort
images.altText: Bent's Old Fort in background with wagon in front; fall yellow cottonwood leaves in foreground
images.caption: For much of its 16-year history, the fort was the only major permanent white settlement on the Santa Fe Trail between Missouri and the Mexican settlements.

images.title: The Past and Future at Bent's Old Fort
images.altText: A Conestoga wagon and a solar race car stand on a road with a large adobe fort in the background
images.caption: The Past and Future at Bent's Old Fort

images.title: Saddles in the Plaza
images.altText: A row of saddles are arrayed along a wooden beam near an adobe building
images.caption: Pack saddles are at the ready.

images.title: Traderoom
images.altText: A wooden counter is in the foreground of a trade room, with sales items on display in the background
images.caption: The trade room catered to trappers, traders, the fort's labor force, and travelers from the ranks of soldiers, explorers, and adventurers.
